Welcome to (Game Name)!\n\nIn this game, we are going to learn some of the basic and most important core concepts of programming.

There are 4 basic programming topics that we're going to cover:
• Variables
• Arithmetic
• Conditions
• Looping
These concepts make up the foundation of programming and so it\'s very important that we learn them.\n\nSo let\'s get started!
First up are Variables.\n\nVariables are used to store pieces of information such as words, phrases or numbers.

We can think of Variables like a box in which we can put some piece of information.\n\nOnce the information is in the box, we can open the box to see what\'s inside and even possibly add something else in too.

So what does a Variable look like?

Variables have a 
name and a value.

For example, a Variable could be called Colour and its value could be Blue.

There are 3 main types of data that a Variable can store:
•Numbers
•Strings
•Booleans.

Let's have a closer look at these 3 data types.

A Number is one of the simplest types of data. We can use Variables to store numbers.

For example, a score in a game. At the beginning of the game, the value of the score will be 0.

Every time the player gets a point, this score will increase, adding 1 to the value of the score each time.
A String can be used to represent a word or phrase.\n\nIn the Colour example used earlier, the value Blue is a word and so that also makes it a String too.
Another example of a String Variable would be Animal.\n\nA Dog is an animal and so we could make a new variable with the name Animal and the value Dog.

The final data type for now is Boolean.

The value of Boolean Variables will always be either True or False.

Booleans can be used for answering Yes or No questions or to check if an action or event has occurred.

We can use Booleans to identify when something is true or false.

Let's pretend we are playing a game where somebody is thinking about a certain Animal.

To try and guess what Animal they are thinking of, we can only ask Yes or No questions.

So I might ask "Does the animal have 4 legs?"

If the answer is "Yes", then this is True.

If the answer is "No", then this is False.
Let\'s say that the answer is True, I can make a variable using this information.\n\nI can call my variable hasFourLegs and its value is True.
Now that we know what Variables are, we can start to make our player character for this game.
We\'re going to use Variables to build our character profile.\n\nFirst of all, the character needs a name.
Name is an example of a String variable. Our name is a piece of information (a word) and so we can store it in a variable.
